package.name: dexie
package.usage: IndexedDB database wrapper - all data access

constraint.details: All data stored in IndexedDB via Dexie.js, no backend. Tech spec references Prisma/Postgres but project uses Dexie. Adapt all data models to Dexie schema (src/lib/db/schema.ts).

Service layer must be pure and testable. Separate computation (CombinationAnalysisService) from orchestration (CorrelationOrchestrationService) and data access (repositories). Follow CorrelationService pattern.
Arrays stored as JSON strings in Dexie (foodIds, foodNames). Must JSON.parse() on read, JSON.stringify() on write. Per AGENTS.md: "Arrays stored as JSON strings in database (must parse on read)".

Always query using compound indexes [userId+field] to avoid full scans. Per AGENTS.md: "Compound indexes critical for performance - always query using [userId+field] patterns." For combination queries, index on [userId+mealId] or [userId+timestamp].

Use Chi-square test for statistical significance (p < 0.05 per ADR-008). Reuse chiSquare() function from CorrelationService. Requires minimum sample size (3 instances per AC4). Follow existing implementation pattern.

Synergy defined as combination correlation exceeding max individual correlation by 15% (0.15 delta). Per Dev Notes: "synergistic = combinationCorrelation > maxIndividual + 0.15". Clear threshold for flagging synergistic effects.

Minimum coverage: 80% branches, functions, lines, statements. Per AGENTS.md: "Coverage: 80% minimum across branches, functions, lines, statements." Use Jest + React Testing Library. Test all edge cases (empty meals, single foods, insufficient samples).
FoodCombinationCard must meet WCAG 2.1 Level AA. Use semantic HTML, ARIA labels, keyboard navigation, color contrast. Test with screen readers. Follow existing component accessibility patterns.

interface.name: CombinationAnalysisService
interface.purpose: Pure computation service for detecting synergistic food combinations

interface.name: FoodCombinationCard
interface.purpose: React component displaying synergistic food combination with visual indicators

pattern.name: Pure Service Layer
pattern.description: Computation logic separated from data access. Services are pure functions, testable without DB mocking.
pattern.example: CorrelationService.computePairWithData() accepts in-memory data arrays, returns WindowScore[]. No DB calls inside pure service.
pattern.application: CombinationAnalysisService.detectCombinations() should accept meal events array and symptom instances array as parameters. No repository calls inside detection logic.

pattern.name: Orchestration Service
pattern.description: Orchestration layer hydrates data from repositories and delegates to pure services.
pattern.example: CorrelationOrchestrationService hydrates food events and symptom instances via repositories, then calls computePairWithData().
pattern.application: Extend CorrelationOrchestrationService.computeCorrelation() to invoke CombinationAnalysisService after individual correlations computed. Pass meal-grouped events and individual results.

pattern.name: Chi-Square Statistical Test
pattern.description: 2x2 contingency table for categorical correlation (food present vs symptom present).
pattern.example: chiSquare(a, b, c, d) in CorrelationService computes chi-square statistic from contingency table. Returns score, higher = stronger association.
pattern.application: Reuse chiSquare() function for combination analysis. Table: [combination+symptom, combination+noSymptom, noCombination+symptom, noCombination+noSymptom].

pattern.name: Confidence Level Determination
pattern.description: Classify statistical confidence based on sample size, r-squared/p-value, and correlation strength.
pattern.example: DoseResponseService determines confidence: high (n≥10, r²≥0.7), medium (n≥5, r²≥0.5), low (otherwise).
pattern.application: CombinationAnalysisService should classify confidence: high (n≥10, p<0.01), medium (n≥5, p<0.05), low (n<5 or p≥0.05). Reject if n<3 per AC4.

pattern.name: JSON Array Parsing
pattern.description: Dexie stores arrays as JSON strings. Must parse on read, stringify on write.
pattern.example: foodEventRepository parses foodIds: const foodIds = JSON.parse(event.foodIds) as string[];
pattern.application: When reading FoodEventRecords for combination analysis, parse foodIds and foodNames arrays. When writing FoodCombination results, stringify foodIds[] and foodNames[].

pattern.name: Compound Index Queries
pattern.description: Use compound indexes [userId+field] for efficient range queries.
pattern.example: foodEventRepository.findByDateRange() uses [userId, timestamp] compound index, filters by userId first.
pattern.application: Query meal events by [userId+mealId] or [userId+timestamp]. Ensure Dexie schema has appropriate compound indexes for combination queries.

test-idea.description: Unit: Meal grouping by mealId correctly identifies food combinations
test-idea.approach: Given 3 meal events with mealIds (M1, M1, M2), each with 2 foods. Verify function returns 2 unique combinations for M1, 1 for M2. Test single-food meals are excluded (no combination with self).

test-idea.description: Unit: Food pair enumeration generates unique combinations without duplicates
test-idea.approach: Given meal with foods [A, B, C], verify function returns pairs [(A,B), (A,C), (B,C)] without duplicates like (B,A). Test ordering consistency.

test-idea.description: Unit: Combination correlation calculation uses Chi-square correctly
test-idea.approach: Mock meal events with known food combinations. Mock symptom instances at known times. Verify Chi-square score computed for combination vs baseline. Compare against hand-calculated expected value.

test-idea.description: Unit: Individual max correlation correctly identified from pair
test-idea.approach: Given individualCorrelations [(A→symptom: 0.4), (B→symptom: 0.6)], verify maxIndividual = 0.6 for combination (A+B). Test with missing individual correlations (fallback to 0).

test-idea.description: Unit: Synergy detection flags combinations exceeding 15% threshold
test-idea.approach: Test cases: combinationCorr=0.75, maxIndividual=0.55 → synergistic=true (0.75 > 0.70). Test boundary: 0.70 vs 0.55 → true, 0.69 vs 0.55 → false. Test negative cases.

test-idea.description: Unit: Sample size filter rejects combinations with <3 instances
test-idea.approach: Test combinations with sampleSize [0, 1, 2, 3, 10]. Verify n<3 returns empty array or undefined. Verify n≥3 proceeds to analysis. Test minSampleSize parameter override.

test-idea.description: Component: FoodCombinationCard renders synergy indicator correctly
test-idea.approach: Render with synergistic=true combination. Verify synergy badge visible with text ">15% stronger together" or similar. Test color coding (green/yellow). Verify accessible ARIA labels.
Render with combinationCorr=0.65, individualMax=0.42. Verify both values displayed. Test comparison bar chart or visual indicator. Verify accessible text "65% vs 42% individually".
Test rendering with confidence=high, medium, low. Verify correct badge color and text. Test accessible tooltips explaining confidence levels. Verify ARIA attributes for screen readers.

test-idea.description: Unit: Chi-square p-value calculation and significance filtering
test-idea.approach: Given Chi-square score, compute p-value (or mock). Test filtering: p<0.05 → included, p≥0.05 → excluded per ADR-008. Test edge case p=0.05 (boundary).

test-idea.description: Integration: End-to-end combination detection with mocked repositories
test-idea.approach: Mock foodEventRepository to return meal events with shared mealIds. Mock symptomInstanceRepository to return symptom instances. Mock individual correlations. Call orchestration service, verify FoodCombination results include all expected fields, correct synergy flags, and proper confidence levels.

Mock repositories with realistic meal data (10 meals, 5 food pairs, 20 symptom instances). Call computeCorrelation(), verify both individual correlations and combinations returned. Test caching of combination results alongside individual results.

test-idea.description: Edge case: Empty meal data returns empty combinations
test-idea.approach: Test with no meal events. Verify detectCombinations() returns empty array without errors. Test with meals containing single foods (no pairs) - verify no combinations generated.

test-idea.description: Edge case: Insufficient sample size for all pairs
test-idea.approach: Given 5 different food pairs, each with only 2 instances. Verify all pairs filtered out (n<3). Test mixed scenario: 2 pairs with n≥3, 3 pairs with n<3, verify only valid pairs analyzed.

test-idea.description: Edge case: No individual correlations available for comparison
test-idea.approach: Test combination analysis when individualCorrelations array is empty. Verify maxIndividual defaults to 0. Test synergy detection still works (combinationCorr > 0.15 → synergistic).

note.title: Dexie vs Prisma Discrepancy
note.content: Tech spec references Prisma/Postgres models but project actually uses IndexedDB via Dexie.js. All data models must be adapted to Dexie schema in src/lib/db/schema.ts. Use existing FoodEventRecord pattern with JSON stringified arrays. No Prisma migrations - use Dexie version upgrades in db/client.ts if schema changes needed.

note.title: Chi-Square Implementation
note.content: Reuse existing chiSquare() function from CorrelationService. Builds 2x2 contingency table: [combination+symptom, combination+noSymptom, noCombination+symptom, noCombination+noSymptom]. Returns Chi-square score, higher = stronger association. Pair with p-value calculation for significance filtering (p < 0.05 per ADR-008).

note.title: Synergy Threshold Calculation
note.content: Synergy defined as combination correlation exceeding max individual correlation by 15% absolute (0.15 delta). Formula: synergistic = combinationCorrelation > maxIndividual + 0.15. Example: if dairy=0.42 and gluten=0.38, then maxIndividual=0.42. Combination must be >0.57 (0.42+0.15) to flag as synergistic. Clear, interpretable threshold for users.

note.title: Meal Grouping Strategy
note.content: FoodEventRecords with shared mealId represent foods consumed together. Query foodEventRepository by userId and timestamp range, then group by mealId in memory. For each meal group, enumerate unique food pairs using combinations logic (avoid duplicates, no self-pairs). Filter single-food meals (no combinations possible).

note.title: Sample Size Filtering
note.content: Per AC4, minimum 3 instances required for combination analysis. Count number of meal events containing specific food pair. If count < 3, skip analysis for that pair (insufficient statistical power). This prevents false positives from small samples. Apply filter before calling Chi-square to avoid wasted computation.

note.title: Orchestration Integration
note.content: Extend CorrelationOrchestrationService.computeCorrelation() to invoke CombinationAnalysisService after individual correlations computed. Pass meal-grouped food events, symptom instances, and individual correlation results. Append combination results to return payload. Cache combinations alongside individual correlations in analysisResults table (extend schema if needed).

note.title: Dashboard Integration
note.content: Add FoodCombinationCard section to TriggerCorrelationDashboard below individual correlations. Sort combinations by synergy strength (combinationCorr - individualMax) descending. Add toggle to show/hide combinations section. Filter by confidence level and allergen tags (if applicable). Maintain consistent visual language with existing correlation cards.

note.title: Test Coverage Strategy
note.content: Target 15+ unit tests for CombinationAnalysisService (pair enumeration, Chi-square, thresholds, edge cases). Target 8+ component tests for FoodCombinationCard (rendering, accessibility, synergy badges, confidence levels). Target 6+ integration tests for orchestration (end-to-end with mocked repositories, caching, error handling). Aim for 85%+ coverage to exceed 80% minimum.
